fr.upmc.colins.farm3.actuator

Class Actuator

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.upmc.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.upmc.colins.farm3.actuator.Actuator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.ComponentI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicActuator

    public class Actuator
extends fr.upmc.components.AbstractComponent
    The class Actuator implements an actuator

    Description

    An actuator is a component that will forward received requests to its dedicated virtual machine. A target service time is set. The mean service time sent by the request dispatcher is processed and an action is taken if the mean service time is too slow or if it is too fast. A flex time is added to make the target service time for flexible.

    Created on : jan. 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Colins-Alasca

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> assignedCoreControlRequestArrivalInboundPortUris)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        create an actuator

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of the actuator
        boostStep - step value of frequency change (increase or decrease)
        targetServiceTime - target service time (milliseconds)
        flexServiceTime - flex service time (milliseconds)
        actuatorResponseArrivalInboundPortUri - inbound port of the component for response arrival
        assignedCoreControlRequestArrivalInboundPortUris - inbound port of the cores for updating the frequency
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
